heisig_chinese_memo: Trees have branches, birds have wings, and fish have fins.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Trees have branches, birds have wings, and fish have fins.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " feather " and " branch ", the original meaning is the wings used by birds and insects to fly. " Wings " ancient work " Yi ", "Shuowen": "Ying, Yi Ye. Cong Yu Zhisheng. 𦐊, Yan or Cong Shi." "Guang Yun‧ Zhi Yun": "Wings, Yi Ye." "Chu Ci‧Strictly Ji "Wai Shi Ming": "Make a quail cage for the Phoenix Emperor, although the wings are not tolerated." Wang Yi's note: "Wings, one wings."

" Fing " also refers to fish fins. Such as the well-known "shark fin", it is used in this meaning.

Objects shaped like wings can also be called " wings ." The 35th volume of "The Heroes of Sons and Daughters": "Hold the wings of a tea tray with both hands." The "kite wings" and "cloth wings" that are still used in modern Chinese are also used Use this meaning.

In ancient books, " wing " can be used as "啻", as an adverb, meaning "only, only". "Mencius·Gaozixia": "Compared with the one who takes the heavier color and the lighter ceremony, the color of the wing is heavier?" Zhu Xi's notes: "The wings are the same as the qi."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " feather " and " branch ", the original meaning is the wings used by birds and insects to fly.
humanum_full_description:
從「羽」，「支」聲，本義為鳥類和昆蟲等動物用以飛行的羽翼。「翅」古作「翄」，《說文》：「翄，翼也。从羽支聲。𦐊，翄或从氏。」《廣韻‧寘韻》：「翅，翼也。」《楚辭‧嚴忌〈哀時命〉》：「為鳳皇作鶉籠兮，雖翕翅其不容。」王逸注：「翅，一作翼。」

　　「翅」也指魚鰭。如大眾熟知的「魚翅」，即用此義。

　　形狀像翅膀的物體也可稱做「翅」，《兒女英雄傳》第35回：「用雙手端着茶盤翅兒。」現代漢語仍使用的「風箏翅」、「紗冒翅」，亦用此義。

　　古書中「翅」可通作「啻」，作副詞，表示「只、僅」。《孟子‧告子下》：「取色之重者與禮之輕者而比之，奚翅色重？」朱熹集注：「翅，與啻同。」
humanum_short_description: 從「羽」，「支」聲，本義為鳥類和昆蟲等動物用以飛行的羽翼。

Chinese: Trees have branches, birds have wings, and fish have fins.
Meaning: fins
Story: Trees have branches, birds have wings, and fish have fins.
Kind: both

從「 羽 」，「 支 」聲，本義為鳥類和昆蟲等動物用以飛行的羽翼。「 翅 」古作「 翄 」，《說文》：「翄，翼也。从羽支聲。𦐊，翄或从氏。」《廣韻‧寘韻》：「翅，翼也。」《楚辭‧嚴忌〈哀時命〉》：「為鳳皇作鶉籠兮，雖翕翅其不容。」王逸注：「翅，一作翼。」 「 翅 」也指魚鰭。如大眾熟知的「魚翅」，即用此義。 形狀像翅膀的物體也可稱做「 翅 」，《兒女英雄傳》第35回：「用雙手端着茶盤翅兒。」現代漢語仍使用的「風箏翅」、「紗冒翅」，亦用此義。 古書中「 翅 」可通作「 啻 」，作副詞，表示「只、僅」。《孟子‧告子下》：「取色之重者與禮之輕者而比之，奚翅色重？」朱熹集注：「翅，與啻同。」
From the sound of " feather" and " branch", the original meaning is the wings used by birds and insects to fly. " Wings" ancient work " Yi", "Shuowen": "Ying, Yi Ye. Cong Yu Zhisheng. 𦐊, Yan or Cong Shi." "Guang Yun‧ Zhi Yun": "Wings, Yi Ye." "Chu Ci‧Strictly Ji "Wai Shi Ming": "Make a quail cage for the Phoenix Emperor, although the wings are not tolerated." Wang Yi's note: "Wings, one wings." " Fing" also refers to fish fins. Such as the well-known "shark fin", it is used in this meaning. Objects shaped like wings can also be called " wings." The 35th volume of "The Heroes of Sons and Daughters": "Hold the wings of a tea tray with both hands." The "kite wings" and "cloth wings" that are still used in modern Chinese are also used Use this meaning. In ancient books, " wing" can be used as " 啻", as an adverb, meaning "only, only". "Mencius·Gaozixia": "Compared with the one who takes the heavier color and the lighter ceremony, the color of the wing is heavier?" Zhu Xi's notes: "The wings are the same as the qi."

翅字的基本解释

翅
chì
鸟和昆虫等用来飞行的器官：翅膀。翅翼。插翅难飞。
翘出像翅的东西：翅果。纱帽翅。
古同“啻”，但，只。

翅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chì］
［《廣韻》施智切，去寘，書。］
亦作“1”。“翄1”的今字。亦作“翤1”。亦作“翨1”。亦作“鳷2”。
(1)鸟类和昆虫等动物用以飞行的羽翼。通称“翅膀”。
(2)指形状像翅膀的物体或其部分。
(3)翅果向外伸出呈翅状的果皮。
(4)鱼类鳍的别称。
(5)通“啻”。但；仅；止。

翅字的英文翻译

◎ 翅
wing

翅字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【羽字部】　翅； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页955第28
【集韻】翄，亦書作翅。　又【正韻】式至切，音試。同啻。【孟子】奚翅食重。【莊子·大宗師】陰陽于人，不翅于父母。　又【正韻】申之切，音詩。不翅猶言不止是。

翅字的源字形

翅字的起名意思

：指鸟类翅膀，飞翔的意思。古同“啻”，但，只。

wing
Basic explanation of words
wing
chì
Flying organs such as birds and insects: wings. Wing wings. Wings are hard to fly.
Thing out like wings: samara. Sha hat wings.
The ancient same "di", but, only.
wing
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chì］
["Guangyun" Shi Zhiqie, go to set, book. ]
Also known as "1". The present character of "翄1". Also known as "翤1". Also known as "翨1". Also known as "Snake 2".
(1) The wings used by birds and insects to fly. Commonly known as "wings."
(2) Refers to an object or part of it that is shaped like a wing.
(3) The samara has a wing-like peel.
(4) Another name for fish fins.
(5) Through "啻". But; only; only.

[Not concentrated] [The Department of Feathers] 　wing; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 955 28
【Ji Yun】翄, also written as wings.　 [Zheng Yun] style to cut, sound test. The same. [Mencius] Heavily eats his wings. 【Zhuangzi·Grand Master】Yin and Yang are for people, but not for parents.　[Zheng Yun] Shen Zhiqie, sound poem. If you don't have wings, it's more than just words.
wing

wing
Name meaning
: Refers to the wings of birds, meaning to fly. The ancient same "di", but, only.
翅
形声字。羽表意,其古文字形体像翅膀上的两片羽毛,支(zhi )表声,支有支撑、维持之义,表示鸟飞行时有赖翅的支
持而不坠落。本义是翅膀。
①翅膀,鸟类或昆虫的飞行器官:双~「插~难飞。②鱼
的鳍:鱼~(特指鲨鱼的鳍)。
chì
~膀 ~果 ~脉 ~鞘 鼻~ 鱼~ 展~ 振~
翅
翅
楷
крыло
Пиктофонетические символы.
В идеографическом плане ее древние символы подобны двум перьям на крыльях.Чжи выражает звук, а поддержка означает поддержку и поддержание, что означает, что птица зависит от поддержки крыльев и не падает во время полета.
Первоначальное значение - крылья.
①Крылья, летающие органы птиц или насекомых: двойная ~ "пробка ~ трудно летать." Плавник рыбы: рыба ~ (особенно плавник акулы).
~ Мочевой пузырь ~ фрукты ~ пульс ~ оболочка носа ~ рыба ~ чжань ~ чжэнь ~
